thread.title_full: PFF grades from the Tampa Bay Buccaneers Week 7 loss to the Detroit Lions - NewsBreak

author: Andrew Harbaugh
title: PFF grades from the Tampa Bay Buccaneers Week 7 loss to the Detroit Lions - NewsBreak
text:
By Andrew Harbaugh ,
3 hours ago Oct 20, 2025; Detroit, Michigan, USA; Tampa Bay Buccaneers running back Rachaad White (1) attempts to make a catch against Detroit Lions linebacker Jack Campbell (46) during the second half at Ford Field. Mandatory Credit: David Reginek-Imagn Images By David Reginek, David Reginek-Imagn Images The NFL season will sometimes show us what we want to see from players; other times, we may see something bad when it isn't there. For fans and media, it's essential to have a way to verify and balance information to prevent favoritism or bias from being portrayed in a negative light.
Thanks to PFF, we will always have an extra set of eyes to examine the football game.
The Bucs had few high grades or performances in Week 7 of the regular season. The grades could be some of the highest we have ever seen in the history of PFF.
Here are the best and worst from the PFF grades for the Bucs' loss to the Lions .

WR Tez Johnson 78
TE Cade Otton 67.7
G Ben Bredeson 66.7
